- updated EULA and Privacy Policy

- OneDrive / SharePoint connection now supports Microsoft Azure AD authentication on managed devices
- OneDrive / SharePoint connection now supports Microsoft Azure AD authentication on managed devices

- the app now accepts drag-and-drop files and folders from compatible apps such as Files and Photos (iPad only)
- PDF Annotations improvement: fill color for rectangles and ovals can now be edited or removed

Minor interface improvements.
Minor interface improvements.

Support for amazing iOS 14 features:
- Widgets. Two beautiful types of widgets to bring file shortcuts and most used buttons right at your fingertips.
- Scribble. GoodReader works perfectly with Apple Pencil and Scribble - new iOS 14 experience allowing you to simply write where you previously had to type.

minor bug fixes and improvements
- support for Dropbox's scope-based authentication and short-lived access tokens

- improved compatibility with newer versions of iOS and iPadOS

With this update, we'll be asking you to agree to a new EULA, and it's a good thing! We're now asking for much fewer permissions from you to collect analytics data. We've modified Section 2 of the EULA by removing references to third parties collecting data. For quite a while, we were using a certain big-name 3rd-party analytics software. But being privacy advocates we are, we never liked the idea of having some software that we have no control of linked to our code. So we've finally written our own super-lightweight and non-intrusive analytics package that only collects the absolute minimum of the information we need - which buttons you pressed, and which you didn't - stuff like that. And now we can guarantee it. Because we wrote every single line of that code ourselves! So please kindly press Accept EULA after installing this update and rest assured that your privacy will always be our priority!
